Ok, I'll bite...

What, in particular are you trying to test? You're describing a  
life-cycle kinda issue, but only showing part of an if statement.

Are you trying to test the if statement?
Connection management?
Client/Server interactions?
Something else entirely?

-- Levi

On Thursday, March 27, 2003, at 09:37  AM, skss2002@... wrote:

> Hello all again,
>
> Still awaiting somebody would lend a helping hand.  I have a simple RMI
> server providing database service supported by a one-file,  
> non-relational
> database.  Database clients pass their object reference to the server  
> when
> connecting, and so the server can detect a dead connection by the  
> following
> if-statement and
> recycles the connection for another client:
>
>        if (clientObject != null && clientObject.equals(null)) { ... }
>
> Right now, I just open a few OS shells (Windows XP) and run the  
> clients to
> connect to the server, manually close a shell, and check the println
> statements I placed in the server to see that it is indeed working.   
> It would
> be great if a TestCase can simulate that.
>
> Thanks in advance.
>
> Sam
>
